text:
Hey everyone - seeking some negotiation advice :slightly_smiling_face:

I’m a FT freelance D&I consultant and Inclusive Communities Manager. My structure is that I have 2 main clients and aim to take on ‘pick-my-brain’ consultation sessions in 2022.

On the community management front I’ve been managing and facilitating the Slack community and socials for a client remotely.

My role is shifting soon in the direction of leading the community for this client’s new venture 100% and i’d be rebuilding their social from scratch too. Transitioning my existing Slack community over to their new project and reconfiguring the structure + implementing new frameworks. Leading and curating community-focused partnerships.

I want to continue managing their existing Twitter account as a separate entity (kinda like Chapin does for R/GA). This would be a separate price too and include community management (strategy + execution + comments + dms).

*Would anyone be willing to talk freelance fee expectations, please?*

I’m keen to remain freelance + keep my hours down (move from hourly to daily rate). Plus ensure my rate is competing with USA industry standards.

Happy to outline more details in DMs as cannot share some things publicly. E.g. current fee + role breakdown etc

Thanks in advance.

elements.text: Hey everyone - seeking some negotiation advice

I’m a FT freelance D&I consultant and Inclusive Communities Manager. My structure is that I have 2 main clients and aim to take on ‘pick-my-brain’ consultation sessions in 2022.

On the community management front I’ve been managing and facilitating the Slack community and socials for a client remotely.

My role is shifting soon in the direction of leading the community for this client’s new venture 100% and i’d be rebuilding their social from scratch too. Transitioning my existing Slack community over to their new project and reconfiguring the structure + implementing new frameworks. Leading and curating community-focused partnerships.

I want to continue managing their existing Twitter account as a separate entity (kinda like Chapin does for R/GA). This would be a separate price too and include community management (strategy + execution + comments + dms).
Would anyone be willing to talk freelance fee expectations, please?

I’m keen to remain freelance + keep my hours down (move from hourly to daily rate). Plus ensure my rate is competing with USA industry standards.

Happy to outline more details in DMs as cannot share some things publicly. E.g. current fee + role breakdown etc

Thanks in advance.

text: As a freelancer, I've learned to say "bye Felicia" to clients I don't like. I ONLY work with clients who I love and who respect my personal and professional boundaries. I won't take a job (or will quit one) if it doesn't hit those markers for me. There is a reason I went freelance, and it isn't always about the money!

text:
Just the messenger, not connected to this role at all:

Yahoo Finance is looking for a digital producer to help scale its VOD business. What this role entails is daily uploading work for live segments, placement of those videos in relevant trending stories, occasional writing of original stories related to live segments, tracking and analyzing performance of VOD, and supporting the near-real time clipping operation for @YahooFinance Twitter.

S_end resumes and cover letters (optional) to <mailto:mbkelley@yahoofinance.com|mbkelley@yahoofinance.com>._ 

Full job description: 

*Yahoo Finance Digital Producer (contractor)*
Responsibilities
· ● Provide support for uploading of Yahoo Finance Live show VOD.
· ● Provide support for placing VOD in trending stories.
· ● Provide support for tracking and analyzing performance.
· ● Write original content as needed.
· ● Clip the Yahoo Finance Live show for Twitter as needed.
Required Qualifications
· ● 1-3 years experience working as a copy editor or editor at a media organization.
· ● Strong communication skills.
· ● Ability to learn headline writing and photo choices.
· ● Strong news judgement for watching VOD and making real-time framing decisions.
· ● A good attitude and strong work ethic.
Preferred Qualifications
· ● Comprehensive understanding of broadcast production
· ● B.A. preferred or equivalent job experience
· ● SEO knowledge is a plus
